name: maize grain production | maize grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21653/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Maize during January-June, 2016 at a farm located in village Rattipur, District Ludhiana of Punjab. In this area, fields are irrigated with ground water using electric pump for surface irrigation. The farm has a yield of 7500 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Sowing date for the crop is 20-Feburary, 2016 and harvesting date is 15-June, 2016. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 275-115-75 kg/ha. Herbicide used has active ingredient as Attrazine 625g/ha, Insecticide used has active ingredient as Chlorpyrifos 400g/ha. Machinery is used only for soil cultivation with fuel consumption of 35.36 kg/ha using plough, hoeing, earthen up rotary cultivator for soil tillage and for other work process machinery is used for laser leveling with fuel consumption of 29.12 kg/ha.   

This activity starts about two weeks after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for cultivation in January and sowing of seeds started about five weeks after soil preparation. Thereafter the crop is mature for harvesting in about 5 months.


The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Maize from the Maize plant
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Soil cultivating date for the main crop: 26-January, 2016; Harvesting date main crop: 15-June, 2016. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. Total time from date of sowing to date of harvesting comes to 155 days.  The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village Rattipur, District Ludhiana of Punjab
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: : Cultivation of Maize follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process. Number of wet days have been taken for the district (Ludhiana) and rainfall data is Normal rainfall for Punjab where the farm is located.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production. The farmer does not maintain any written records and has provided the data from recent memory. In this region, typically farmers are unable to provide exact name of active ingredient in the pesticide they use and the same was noted from details given on the pesticide packet. Individual farmer is not able to calculate fuel consumption for his own farm alone and this information has been collected from farming community of the area.

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of maize grain is calculated to be circa 1.37E-04 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: 'atrazine', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.73E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'maize grain' is calculated to be circa 6.20E-02 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.24E-01 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
